IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: OUR MISSION IS TO GLORIFY GOD BY PROVIDING HIGH-QUALITY, WORLD-CLASS CHRISTIAN EDUCATION FOR OUR STUDENTS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: OUR MISSION IS TO GLORIFY GOD BY PROVIDING HIGH-QUALITY, WORLD-CLASS CHRISTIAN EDUCATION FOR OUR STUDENTS.
IRS990.Desc: THE PURPOSE OF GRAND VIEW CHRISTIAN SCHOOL ASSOCIATION,INC IS TO ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN CHRISTIAN SCHOOLS WHERE THE PRIMARY EMPHASIS IN TEACHING IS THE GLORIFICATION OF GOD BY BUILDING CHRIST-LIKE CHARACTER INTO THE LIVES OF PUPILS AND REINFORCING THE CHRISTIAN WORLD VIEW AS A FOUNDATION FOR SCHOLASTIC ACHIEVEMENT.GRAND VIEW CHRISTIAN SCHOOL ASSOCIATION, INC. PROVIDES EDUCATION FOR STUDENTS FROM PRE-K THRU 12TH GRADE. THE AUGUST 2022 SCHOOL YEAR STARTED WITH 800 STUDENTS.PROGRAM SERVICE REVENUE CONSISTS OF PAYMENTS RECEIVED FOR TUITION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Line 3 - Racially Nondiscriminatory Policy Publicized
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GRAND VIEW CHRISTIAN SCHOOL ASSOCIATION, INC. DISPLAYS THE FOLLOWING STATEMENT ON ALL STUDENT APPLICATIONS:GRANDVIEW CHRISTIAN SCHOOL ASSOCIATION, INC. ADMITS STUDENTS OF ANY RACE, COLOR, NATIONAL AND ETHNIC ORIGIN TO ALL THE RIGHTS, PRIVILEGES, PROGRAMS, AND ACTIVITIES GENERALLY ACCORDED OR MADE AVAILABLE TO STUDENTS AT THE SCHOOL. IT DOES NOT DISCRIMINATE ON THE BASIS OF RACE, COLOR, NATIONAL AND ETHNIC ORIGIN IN ADMINISTRATION OF ITS EDUCATIONAL POLICIES, ADMISSIONS POLICIES, SCHOLARSHIP AND LOAN PROGRAMS, AND ATHLETIC AND OTHER SCHOOL-ADMINISTERED PROGRAMS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Line 4 - Explanation of Records and Materials Not Maintained
Schedule E, Line 5 - Explanation of Organization Discrimination by Race
Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CHANGES WERE MADE IN BYLAWS REGARDING THE PROCESS OF NOMINATING AND AFFIRMING BOARD MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization members are composed of parents and grandparents of children in the school and donors to the school.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS DISTRIBUTED TO EACH DIRECTOR AT A REGULAR BOARD MEETING OR E-MAILED TO THE DIRECTOR PRIOR TO FILING OF THE RETURN.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Conflicts of interest are reviewed annually and each board member indicates whether the member does or does not have any conflict of interest.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPENSATION AND APPROVAL OF THE ADMINISTRATORS IS ESTABLISHED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPENSATION AND APPROVAL OF THE STAFF IS ESTABLISHED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, POLICIES AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE AT THE SCHOOL ADMINISTRATION OFFICE UPON REQUEST.
